If you think it hurts every time you visit the gas pump, believe it or not, some gas station operators are hurting too.

He's been in the business for 40 years but hasn't turned a profit in a year.
To make matters worse, he just got a letter from Exxon Mobil saying they may soon close him down.
And they can do that because they officially own the station.
Burke says between the high cost of fuel, credit card fees and rent he pays to Exxon, it's practically impossible for him to stay afloat.
Average service station my size costs $30,000 a month to month to run.
Now, if you're working on 10, 12, 13 cents a gallon, it's not enough to pay the bills.
So how have you been keeping things together?
We just noted that you haven't turned a profit in a year.
Oh, more than a year.
But no, we've been basically fortunate enough to be in business as long as we have.

I have...

Basically, I'm semi-retired.

Now, the profits that you make from the convenience store, are you able to hold on to those?
Or are there any profits?
Well, basically, if you look at a day by day picture - I'll give you an example.
Hold on just a minute.
